entry.title: Sales_Q&A - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 7th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Sales.

  • Recording - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales_Q&A)
  • Presentation - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales_Q&A)  
  • Accelerator Guide - Sales Implementation Accelerator  

Key Discussion Points‌

‌1. Transition Overview‌

  • New company code and sales organization will be created for Bulgaria’s EUR transition, effective January 2026.
  • Master data (customer, material, pricing) must be extended to the new sales org; transactional data (orders, deliveries) must be recreated.

‌2. Sales Area Impact‌

  • ‌Master Data Updates‌:
    • ‌Customer/Material Master‌: Extend to new sales org via Fiori apps or migration cockpit.
    • ‌Pricing‌: Update condition records with new sales org/currency.
    • ‌BOMs/Customer Hierarchies‌: Migrate using dedicated objects (e.g., "material BOM").
  • ‌Transactional Data‌:
    • ‌Orders/Quotations‌: Close existing documents (set rejection reason) and recreate in new org.
    • ‌Billing Documents‌: Cancel and regenerate with EUR currency.

‌3. Manual Activities‌

  • Output forms, tax conditions, and workflows require updates to reflect EUR currency.
  • Sales orders with billing plans/WBS elements must be manually recreated (no migration tool).

Live Questions & Answers

Topic Area‌

‌Question‌

‌Answer

‌Sales Orders with WBS‌

The sales order can be in various states of delivery and invoicing.  How do you recommend handling the orders for which delivery is already created? We also have bought in and drop shipment/third party procurement scenario. So, there might be PO linked to the SO Item. How to handle sales orders in delivery/invoicing stages or with linked POs?

Reject deliveries and close orders to regenerate in new org. Linked POs must also be reversed.

‌EPPM Projects‌

Migration approach for projects linked to sales orders (cost collection)?

Projects likely need extension to new sales org; consult project line experts for confirmation.

‌Checklist Request‌

Can a procurement-style checklist be provided for sales?

Presenter will add a checklist slide to the session materials.

 Call-to-Action

  • Impacted partners/customers could start transition
  • Final planned session: ad-hoc sessions may follow based on feedback

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

If you want to publish content that was helped/created by GenAI, you must add the user tag  GenAI Assisted Content. For content where it's not possible to add a user tag (e.g., answers), you must include this statement: "GenAI was used to help generate this content." We have edited your answer and added the GenAI-statement as we detected AI-generated content in your post. Thank you for your contribution in the SAP Community!

Regards,

Kavya

entry.title: ‌🇫🇷‌ User Group Convention 2025 France USF
entry.content:
This year marks the 35th anniversary of the USF (SAP User Group France) - a major milestone for one of Europe’s most active SAP user communities. The annual convention will take place in Lyon, bringing together more than 2,500 participants from across industries to exchange ideas, share experiences, and explore SAP solutions.

SAP Localization will be part of the agenda with a dedicated session:

“Implementation of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance with RUBIX Consulting for Rémy Cointreau”
🗓 October 8 at 3:00 PM CET

In this session, we’ll walk through how Rémy Cointreau, a global leader in premium spirits, implemented SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) with support from RUBIX Consulting. It’s a great opportunity to hear about real-world project insights and lessons learned.

There will also be a workshop on e-invoicing, focused more on customer feedback - a chance to hear directly from users about their experiences and challenges.

Whether you're working in localization, compliance, or simply interested in how SAP solutions are being applied in practice, we look forward to seeing you there.

REGISTER NOW

Want to connect with others and learn more about DRC in France? Join the France - SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Work Zone group, where SAP experts share updates and guidance.

entry.title: Re: GLO_LOG_REF1_HD update with standard method
entry.content:
During billing creation, use BAdI SD_BIL_CUSTOMER_DATA → method FILL_VBRK_VBRP. Or the classic user exit USEREXIT_FILL_VBRK_VBRP in include RV60AFZZ. Here you can derive the correct indicator from the sales order, delivery, or custom logic and populate VBRK-GLO_LOG_REF1_HD.
After billing creation, use BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CHANGE (if available in your release) or the update FM SD_BIL_DOCUMENT_UPDATE. This is the safe way to update existing billing documents without direct table updates.

entry.title: Re: CC Rerating behavior when no counter snapshot is pres...
entry.content:
Hello,

Yes you can increase this number by using the setupTool command migration increaseCounterSnapshotCount . Be aware that il will require a server downtime . Be also aware that it will not create data in the past, meaning that you will take advantage of this increase in the future only. 

Regarding your second question, the counter snapshots are computed according to the received events. As you don't have recurring event, you have snapshot for the 40 days before the last usage event. 

Best regards,

Eric F.

entry.title: Cannot Post Goods Receipt (Movement Type 101) against PO using released APIs in S/4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are implementing a custom Fiori app (RF-style) on S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition where the business requirement is to post a goods receipt (GR) with movement type 101 against a Purchase Order.

What we tried so far:

OData V2 – Material Documents (API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV v2)

  • Deep insert with PurchaseOrder, PurchaseOrderItem, MovementType = 101.

  • Result: 400 errors

    Property PURCHASEORDER is not supported for GoodsMovementType 101
    Property DELIVERY is not supported for GoodsMovementType 101

    → Conclusion: In Cloud, 101 is blocked for PO/Delivery fields.

  • OData V2 – Inbound Delivery API (PostGoodsReceipt function import) -yet to try

Call works, but posts all open quantities automatically.

Missing control for:

  • Partial quantity (RQTY input by user)

  • Batch / Storage location override

  • Movement type override

  • Material Document – Create via Communication Scenario SAP_COM_0108

Activated successfully, but again PO-based 101 not allowed.

What we discovered:

According to SAP API Hub and testing:

The only released API that supports partial qty, batch, 101 against PO in Public Cloud is:

OData V4

Service: api_inbound_delivery_gm/srvd_a2x/sap/inbounddeliverygm/0001

Entity:  POST /GoodsMovement

However, when we try to add this service in S/4HC:

We cannot see it in Communication Arrangement list.

Direct metadata call returns 403 Forbidden (UCON blocked).

we would like to get help form you on following points

  • Is api_inbound_delivery_gm (V4) officially released and consumable in Public Cloud?

  • If yes → how do we enable it? (Which Communication Scenario ID? Or via Custom Comm. Scenario?)

  • If no → what is the official supported API to post a PO-based 101 GR with partial qty + batch from an RF/Fiori app?

entry.title: AI Demo Ideas for S/4HANA Public Cloud (2508 TDD) - Finance/Accounting Focus
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I need some advice from the community.

Our customer's executive has requested an AI-focused demo using SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud edition. The focus should be on Finance/Accounting or cross-functional processes.

Context: Environment: 2508 TDD system
Constraint: Cannot use other products like SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management
Target audience: C-level executives in food manufacturing/retail industry
My scope: Accounting/Finance modules

What I'm looking for:
An "AI-powered" or "next-generation" demo that:

Looks impressive and innovative
Doesn't require extensive setup (realistic prep time)
Can be demonstrated within standard S/4HANA Public Cloud capabilities
Preferably something other than Joule (looking for alternatives!)

Initial thoughts:

Predictive analytics for cash flow?
Intelligent automation in financial closing?
ML-based anomaly detection?

Has anyone successfully demonstrated similar scenarios? What worked well? Any tips on quick wins that showcase AI capabilities effectively?
Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Delegating approvers in SAP Focused Build
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

 

Is there any possibility for Delegating approvers in requirement approval procedures in SAP Focused Build

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Delegating approvers in SAP Focused Build
entry.content:
Hello,

 

Please see Approval Procedures | SAP Help Portal . The substitution functionality could help you achieve what you are looking for.

From the help page:

"You can designate a substitute, who can also approve or reject your requests for change, for example, while you are out of the office. In the WebClient UI, select Maintain Substitute and choose the business partner who is your substitute. Your substitute’s user needs authorization object SM_APP_AP with activity Accept for the specific transaction types.

The system sends a workflow item to the original approver and to the assigned substitute."

 

Best regards, 

 

SAP Support

I am joining the SAP Community to connect with people and to learn and explore more about SAP. Cheers,
Alva

entry.title: Re: Cannot Post Goods Receipt (Movement Type 101) against...
entry.content:
In Public Cloud, SAP deliberately restricts the Material Document API (OData V2). For movement type 101 against a PO, the fields PurchaseOrder and Delivery are not released → hence the 400 error. This is by design: SAP wants PO-based GRs to flow through the Inbound Delivery process or the released Goods Movement APIs, not through the generic material document service.

The API you mentioned (api_inbound_delivery_gm/srvd_a2x/sap/inbounddeliverygm/0001) is indeed listed on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub and it seems, it is not yet released for Public Edition, or it is only available in Private Cloud / On-Premise editions.

For PO-based 101 GR with partial qty, batch, storage location, you can try with API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV but the standard function import posts all open quantities.

To handle partial qty / batch / storage location, SAP’s guidance is first adjust the inbound delivery items (quantities, batch, storage location) via the Inbound Delivery API (API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV → PATCH/UPDATE on items). Then call PostGoodsReceipt. This way, you control exactly what gets posted. This is the same sequence the standard Fiori apps use (e.g. Post Goods Movement app).

entry.title: Next Generation Just-In-Time, Supply to Customer
entry.content:
The Next Generation JIT Processing solution is now available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Supply to Customer).

 JIT Supply to Customer(S2C) allows you to run just-in-time process with your customer for products delivered from stock or manufactured based on JIT requests. You can receive and process delivery schedules with reference to JIT sales scheduling agreements for planning and production purposes and receive summarized or sequenced JIT calls for shipping purposes. The Next Generation JIT S2C provide bellow business value:

  • Supports the basic business process for just-in-time supply
  • Provides efficiency and transparency in processing
  • Helps process the supply efficiently
  • Flexibility through configuration and extensibility

Let’s take the business of automobile industry as an example, JIT S2C solution will be used on the supply business between Component Manufacturer and Vehicle Manufacturer.

There are two types of JIT Call: Summarized JIT Call and Sequenced JIT Call.

Summarized JIT Call is quantity-based or container-based call-offs without vehicle reference.

Sequenced JIT Call is Order-based requests for supply in sequence of production with Vehicle-specific (reference to VIN/production number).

Let’s focus on Sequenced JIT Call and deep dive further.

From the above lifecycle figure of the Sequenced JIT Calls, you can see that:

  • We start the process from manage customer request by creating Customer JIT Calls. Most of the time JIT Calls will be created via EDI, but manually creating JIT Calls also be supported.
  • If you supply to customer with production, you release JIT Calls to production and confirm production with related goods movements posted.
  • After the manufactured products been received to stock, you pack the products and create outbound deliveries. Post goods issue to the outbound deliveries.
  • Create and process billing document from customer.

We support Monitoring JIT Calls by Internal Processing Status like below. You can easily figure out how many JIT Calls are there and which status they are in.

Overall, next-generation JIT processing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition provides a robust framework for managing complex supply chain operations, offering significant advantages in terms of efficiency, flexibility, and transparency.

entry.title: SII tip for Spain #6: Invoices with zero amounts in SII due to full discounts
entry.content:
Welcome to the SII tips for Spain. In this and subsequent short blogs, we will provide different tips on special SII features in relation to the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance solution.

The tip for today is a very recurring topic which I would like to clarify in this post.

Sometimes invoices are issued with a 100% discount, meaning that no amount will be charged to the customer for this business transaction. In these cases, both the tax tax base and the tax amount will be zero, regardless of the applicable VAT rate (21%, 10% or 4%). The recurring question is whether these invoices are to be submitted to the SII or not.

From our understanding of the law:

  • According to the article 164.Uno.3.º of the VAT Law, companies are obliged to issue an invoice for the delivery of goods or services under the business activity, even in the cases of not subject or VAT exempted transactions. 
  • In case the discount if offered after the transaction takes place, the operation has to be documented with a correction invoice (Credit Memo). The article 80 of the VAT law defines the cases by which the tax base amount can be reduced to zero. Basically:
    • Transactions with discounts of 100%
    • Returns of goods.
  • Additionally, according to article 78.Tres.2º of the VAT law, the tax base amount shall not include "discounts and bonuses which are legally justified and which are granted prior to or simultaneously at the time when the transaction is carried out".

The Directorate of Taxes have published a number of binding answers (consultas vinculates) to these regards, for example.  V1423-08 , V0811-16 , V2088-20, V2635-11, V2966-15,  V1691-06 , ...

In summary, a zero amount invoice does not always mean that the transaction is for free, only it means that the receiver is not paying anything. Even by the fact that invoices with zero amount are not causing any financial disruption, they have to be accounted.

In summary, if you issue an invoice with a 100% discount from the Sales and Distribution module (see note 878428), two main things will happen when the billing Item is replicated in accounting : 

  1. An new invoice number will be consumed (for example, via ODN).
  2. The invoice will be submitted to the SII. Keep in mind that SII will allow zero amount invoices from SD only.

 

In case of additional questions, you can visit the SII help documentation in the following links:

  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Private Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in ERP

Other SII tips:

  • SII tip for Spain #5: SII Adjustments for Canary Islands October 2025

entry.title: How to change Documents Status from "Indexing" to "Active" in SAP Personnel File: Organizer
entry.content:
Hello all, this is my first time here so not really sure if im asking in right page but here's my question.

I am using the SAP Personnel File: Organizer to upload documents.
I found some documents show "indexing" in documents status. And some show "Active". With an "indexing" status, I am not able to make change of the document I uploaded. 

I think I know why it will happen, it is because when I upload documents through "Document Processing", I didn't tick the "Migration" box..

However, even I tried to look into "Execute inbox tasks" in "Document Processing", I still cannot find my way out to change the status from "Indexing" to "Active". Please could anyone have solution of this? I can't even delete those indexing doc. 

Thank you very much

entry.title: FAGL_FCV - Filter Open Items by Reconciliation Account
entry.content:
I would like to explain two issues that we faced in the transaction FAGL_FCV when we filter open items by reconciliation account.

1. Filtering by dynamic selection "reconciliation account" under "Vendor or Customer Company Code", doesn't return the desired results during the "open items - subledger" valuation in transaction code FAGL_FCV. The valuation program doesn't consider or filter by the specific reconciliation accounts entered in the dynamic selection. 

According to the standard design, the valuation logic FAGL_FCV is designed to perform the valuation of payables/receivables based on the valuation of vendor/customer open items. This means that  the valuation of payables/receivables  is according to the balances represented by the related vendor/customer reconciliation accounts. Therefore FAGL_FCV will not propose valuation when program is executed for "balance valuation". 

If you want FAGL_FCV to filter  by customer or vendor reconciliation account, then  use the Dynamic Selections for category  "Customer/Vendor  Line Items"
Then enter the desired Reconciliation Account under field "G/L Account" to restrict the postings to this particular reconciliation account.

Tab Open Items: Subledger -> Vendor/ Customer Selection -> Selections -> Vendor/Customer line items--> G/L Account -> here you can include or exclude posting for a specific reconciliation account.

Reference Note: 3519891 

2. Dynamic selections for reconciliation accounts are not working properly in FAGL_FCV.

When using the free selections of FAGL_FCV, different categories of selections exist:

  • Customer Master
  • Customer Company Code
  • Customer Line Items

Field reconciliation account of category Customer Company Code selects (or excludes) all postings of all customers to which the entered reconciliation account has been assigned to. In case of postings with special GL indicators to these customers, also these postings are selected even though they may have been posted to different GL accounts.

When using the free selection reconciliation account of Customer Company Code all postings of all customers to which this reconciliation account has been assigned to plus all postings with special GL indicator to these customers to different GL accounts are selected (or excluded).

In case you would only like to exclude the postings to the entered reconciliation account, you should use the free selections G/L Account in category Customer Line Items. If the reconciliation account is entered in this selection, only the postings to this particular reconciliation account are excluded.

Please follow these settings:

 

Tab Open Items: Subledger -> Customer Selection -> Selections -> Customer line items--> G/L Account -> here you can exclude a specific reconciliation account.

This way it will not appear in the output list.

Reference Note: 3142560

entry.content: Click on Pack option from tool bar then give Packing material

entry.title: Re: Can you remember the first time you heard of SAP
entry.content:
I first heard of SAP during an internship I landed when I was 17. Everyone was talking about SAP with a sense of "love hate" relationship. Everyone was frustrated by the scale and complexity of it, and yet, it was also the best! 

I worked parallel to SAP for many years, and this trend continued. People would say that doing an SAP implementation was the most difficult thing one could do in their career. I think this complexity and nuance is what drew me to SAP, and is continuing to draw me in.

entry.title: Re: Copying Material code to PO
entry.content: For Purchase Requisitions there is a delivered Excel upload template (in My Purchase Requisitions app). As like PR, for Purchase Orders, SAP does not provide a direct Excel upload template in the UI, but you can create PRs in bulk from Excel (via app or API), then convert them to POs. This is the most business‑friendly approach if the requirement is “upload from Excel.”

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during the Migration of notes with the Migration Object Customer
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

i have the following issue during the migration of texts in the migration object customer. My goal is to migrate texts for customers in a way, so that it is displayed in the notes section of the customer (compare screenshot). The Text should be of the type "accounting note" (Text-ID: 0002).


What i have done so far is, that i filled the fields for the general texts in the migration template. After that i had to edit the mapping in the migration cockpit. The predefined text object (table) seems to be KNA1 (general business partner data), but when i try to map the Text-ID 0002 i get the following error during the simulation: "Text-ID 0002 is invalid for Object KNA1". But when i go into the Business Partner i can add a note with the Text-ID 0002 without a problem.

For the Source Text-ID used a place holder in the template, so "Buchhaltungsnotiz" = "Accounting note". 

After some research i found out, that the Text-IDs are predefined in the Public Cloud, so in my opinion this could only be a problem of a missing assingment between the Text object and the Text ID, but i cant find any customizing setting to change this for the Business Partner. I have only seen settings for the sales areas etc.

My question is, what is the correct Text-ID for this case when i want to migrate accounting notes into the notes section of the general data view of the customers and if it is 0002, what settings do i need to make so this is allowed during the migration.

Best regards 
Lukas

entry.title: aATP - Confirmation Strategies
entry.content:
Hello All 

We are a distribution business with multiple plants and a central DC plant. At present orders are placed with origination plants and then back orders go to the DC plant. The confirmation strategies setup are Gain and with a fall back variant of Improve. Our business approach is that orders from customers are treated equally and work on a first come first served strategy. How would others setup up the confirmation strategies based on our business needs? Should the redistribute strategy be used instead? Keen to hear what others are doing. 

Adam

entry.title: Re: Unable to Add EAN/ECP (MARA-EAN11) to Extended Data S...
entry.content: Hello, thanks for your reply and for sharing those resources. I realize that in my initial message, I didn’t explain the situation clearly and some important information was missing. Let me give you more context so it’s clearer where we are stuck. We are aware that the EAN/EPC field exists in the I_Product CDS view, we have already checked it there and can retrieve it without any issue. We also know how to extend the data source (FDP_PP_MOR_DATA_LIST_SRV) using a Data Source Extension. The problem comes at the final step: Even though we extend the data source and the field appears correctly, the value is always empty when we try to use it in production. Normally, the way to fix this would be to implement a Production BAdI to populate the field at runtime. However, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the BAdIs available for production in this context has very limited capabilities, which means we don’t have the necessary flexibility to add the logic needed to fill this field properly. As a result, even though the field is present in the data source, we cannot make it work because we can’t provide the logic at the production step. So, to summarize our situation: I_Product → we can see and retrieve the EAN without issues. Data Source Extension → we can extend and add the field, just like we did for other standard fields. BAdI in production → this is the blocker. It doesn’t allow us to implement the needed logic, so the field value stays blank in the output. Ideally, the data source extension would automatically fill in the field, as is the case with other standard fields. However, since this is not the case, we depend on a BAdI, and at this time, no BAdI allows us to resolve the issue. Do you know if there is another way to populate this field at runtime, or if there is another BAdI mechanism in the Public Cloud available for Production that offers us more flexibility in this case? Thanks again for your help and guidance. Best regards, ASG.

entry.title: Step Into the Future of Revenue Innovation at the Quote-to-Cash Forum 2025 | October 22-23 | Berlin
entry.content:
Step Into the Future of Revenue Innovation

The pace of change in monetization is accelerating—subscription models, usage-based pricing, and AI-driven revenue are rewriting the rules for every industry. The Quote-to-Cash Forum 2025 is where tomorrow’s leaders converge to learn, network, and lead the transformation.

Join us in Berlin for a two-day, in-person event designed for visionaries, practitioners, and technology partners shaping the next era of quote-to-cash excellence.

Beyond Subscriptions: Mastering Modern Monetization

Quote-to-Cash Forum 2025 | October 22-23, SAP Experience Centre, Berlin
www.Q2CForum.com | Brought to you by SAP & DigitalRoute and CNetwork

Why Attend?

  • Stay Ahead of Market Trends:
    Discover how leading organizations are leveraging cloud-based quote-to-cash solutions, dynamic pricing, and AI-powered analytics to maximize revenue and operational efficiency.
  • Master Subscription & Usage-Based Models:
    Hear from industry experts on implementing flexible billing, metered services, and hybrid monetization strategies that align with evolving customer expectations.
  • Unlock the Power of AI:
    Explore real-world case studies on integrating AI into revenue processes—improving forecasting, automating workflows, and enabling new business models.
  • Network with Innovators:
    Connect with peers, SAP experts, and solution providers—including DigitalRoute—who are driving the future of monetization and digital transformation.

Who Should Attend?

  • Revenue, finance, and billing leaders
  • Subscription and SaaS business executives
  • Product managers and digital transformation strategists
  • Enterprise architects, IT, and operations professionals
  • Anyone seeking to future-proof their revenue operations

What to Expect: Agenda Highlights

Oct 21Pre-conference meetings & informal networking (by appointment)
Oct 22Welcome & opening keynotes, strategic sessions, case studies (IBM, Microsoft, SAP, Zalando, more)
Oct 23AI in Quote-to-Cash, pricing innovation, customer panels, product breakouts, closing reception

Featured Topics:

  • Quote-to-Cash in the Age of Gen AI
  • Pricing the Future: Usage Models & Next-Gen Services
  • Realizing the Quote-to-Cash Vision: Data, Intelligence, Ecosystem
  • Case Studies: SaaS Transformation, Digital Agriculture, Everything-as-a-Service
  • Customer Panel: Unlocking Lifetime Value
  • Best Practices: SAP Ariba Billing Optimization, SAP Premium Engagement

See the full agenda and updates at www.Q2CForum.com

Market Trends Shaping the Forum

  • Rapid Growth: The quote-to-cash software market is projected to reach $10B in 2025, with a 15% CAGR through 2033.
  • Subscription & Usage-Based Models: 67% of consumers now prefer usage-based pricing.
  • AI-Driven Revenue: Predictive analytics and automation are revolutionizing monetization.
  • Customer Experience: Flexibility, personalization, and seamless digital journeys are critical.
  • Global Perspective: Berlin is at the center of regulatory, technological, and business transformation in Europe.

Community & Networking

This isn’t just an event—it’s a movement. Expect dedicated time for community-building, peer roundtables, and 1:1 meetings. Evening receptions and informal networking will help you build lasting connections with fellow leaders and innovators.

Logistics & Registration

  • Location: SAP Experience Centre, George-Stephenson-Strasse 7-13, 10557 Berlin, Germany (Google Maps)
  • Dates: October 22-23, 2025 (Pre-event networking: October 21)
  • Attendance: Standard delegate tickets are valued at €1,250–€1,650. However, a limited number of complimentary tickets are available for senior executives and select leaders in the industry. To ensure a high-value experience and meaningful peer exchange, attendance is by invitation or application only.
  • Nearby Hotels: Recommendations included in the event brochure.

Ready to join this exclusive gathering of industry leaders?
Request your invitation or confirm your place at www.Q2CForum.com.
For questions or group bookings, contact: Rizwan Qayum (rqayum@cnetwork.io)

Let’s build the future of revenue—together. See you in Berlin!

entry.title: Re: Unable to Add EAN/ECP (MARA-EAN11) to Extended Data S...
entry.content:
Hello, thanks for your reply and for sharing those resources.

 

I realize that in my initial message, I didn’t explain the situation clearly and some important information was missing. Let me give you more context so it’s clearer where we are stuck.

 

We are aware that the EAN/EPC field exists in the I_Product CDS view, we have already checked it there and can retrieve it without any issue. We also know how to extend the data source (FDP_PP_MOR_DATA_LIST_SRV) using a Data Source Extension.

 

The problem comes at the final step:
Even though we extend the data source and the field appears correctly, the value is always empty when we try to use it in production. Normally, the way to fix this would be to implement a Production BAdI to populate the field at runtime.

However, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the BAdIs available for production in this context has very limited capabilities, which means we don’t have the necessary flexibility to add the logic needed to fill this field properly. As a result, even though the field is present in the data source, we cannot make it work because we can’t provide the logic at the production step.

 

So, to summarize our situation:

  1. I_Product → we can see and retrieve the EAN without issues.
  2. Data Source Extension → we can extend and add the field, just like we did for other standard fields.
  3. BAdI in production → this is the blocker. It doesn’t allow us to implement the needed logic, so the field value stays blank in the output.

Ideally, the data source extension would automatically fill in the field, as is the case with other standard fields. However, since this is not the case, we depend on a BAdI, and at this time, no BAdI allows us to resolve the issue.

 

Do you know if there is another way to populate this field at runtime, or if there is another BAdI mechanism in the Public Cloud available for Production that offers us more flexibility in this case?

 

Thanks again for your help and guidance.

 

Best regards,

ASG.

entry.title: Re: Configuration Transport Center: New way to view, download and transport configurations
entry.content:
Hello @hariprasadgud ,

While validating an RBP transport, the system generates a series of warnings. My usual process is to review them role by role to determine whether the transport should go ahead. However, I’ve noticed a recurring issue with certain features - for example Manage Calibration Sessions and calibration templates.

Even when the configuration appears identical (eg. the same template with the same name exists in both systems), the validation still produces findings. After raising a ticket on SAP for Me, we learned that these differences occur at the level of the calibration template ID. Technically, that might make sense, but my concern is that the validation rules feel unnecessarily strict in this scenario.

The consequence for me is that I tend to ignore these warnings, since in practice they don’t cause any issues if the transport is executed. Risking that at some point there is a consequence I overlook.

For comparison: there is no warning if the assignments have different ids and are created manually; the system seems not compare IDs here but rather assignment group names, which is a more practical approach.

Given that we are transporting between test systems, it seems reasonable to expect that templates may not always be transported consistently - sometimes they are created manually in one instance, and thus IDs won’t match.

For reference, please see example 1100771/2025 for the details of this case.

Is it possible to take a look at this to make CTC an even more valuable feature?

Thanks,
Roos🌹

entry.title: Re: MIGO - posting period error
entry.content:
When you create a new discussion, please share related screen shots showing the issue without which, it may be difficult to assist. When you say, you checked MMRV, still a screen shot would be better.

Recheck MMRV. if it shows 2025/09, then you can only post in 09/2025 or 08/2025. Ensure, the Company Code you saw in MMRV is same as in PO.

entry.title: Deprecation of CPQ Legacy SMTP Service and DKIM in CPQ
entry.content:
Deprecation of CPQ Legacy SMTP Service and DKIM in CPQ.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Deprecation of CPQ Legacy SMTP Service and DKIM in CPQ
entry.content:
Q: Has DKIM support been officially deprecated in 2508?
A: DKIM is not officially deprecated, since Legacy SMTP service is not deprecated. DKIM feature is only working with Legacy SMTP.

Q: Is DKIM supported for Custom SMTP configurations and SAP's default SMTP service (SAP-provided)?
A: DKIM is feature in the CPQ is not supported for Custom SMTP configuration. For Custom SMTP DKIM needs to be supported on SMTP level, not on application level (CPQ). SAP's default SMTP service has DKIM support on SMTP level.

Q: How can we enable DKIM for outbound notifications using our custom SMTP setup?
A: It must be done on SMTP Level.

Q: Are there any known limitations or additional configurations required for DKIM with the new setup?
A: Like mentioned in previous answers, DKIM feature in the CPQ is only supported for Legacy SMTP service.

entry.title: Re: 🟡 Fun for Week 1: The Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt 🔨🪙
Re: Cannot Post Goods Receipt (Movement Type 101) against...
entry.content: Hi, this is definitely a tricky situation. When a GR with Movement Type 101 fails via released APIs, it often comes down to one of a few issues: either authorization isn’t set correctly for that movement type, the PO isn’t in a status that allows GR posting, or there’s missing or invalid data in the PO line items (account assignment, material master setup, etc.). It might help to check what the API expects vs. what your PO has.

entry.title: Re: Vendor Sub-Ranges Functionality
entry.content:
Hi Teja,

A pop-up will only appear during PO creation if triggered by a partner function. Therefore, it is essential to maintain separate business partners (BPs) for OA or GS partner functions, each with a distinct address, and select the appropriate one when creating a PO. Standard processes do not provide another method to generate this pop-up.

Regards,

Kishan

entry.title: SAP BTP: Creating Connections at Supply Chain Connect
entry.content:
There’s excitement building in the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) team, as we get ready for the SAP Connect event, which will run from 6-8 October in Las Vegas. Of course, SAP Connect is different this year, with five events offered in one location, where attendees can enjoy a conference experience focused on their own Line of Business. Three of my colleagues have already been busy publishing blogs about SAP BTP topics you’ll be able to find at the conference, ijoaquin on Spend Management, rnoia on HCM and joanneks focusing on technology topics. Not wishing to feel left out, I thought that I would share a blog that focuses on my area of interest, SAP BTP for Supply Chain.

In working with my SAP Supply Chain Management colleagues on topics for the Supply Chain Connect event, we’ve decided to focus on SAP BTP capabilities that go to the heart of a “connected” supply chain, where integration and automation are key to creating agility and resilience. It will be of little surprise therefore that it is these very two topics that will be featured in sessions at the event.

Creating Connections

Integration is key to creating connectivity across supply chain systems and processes, and as such I would like to invite you to join my colleague, Craig Stasila, in two sessions where he will take a look at how SAP Integration Suite might be able to help you create a more connected, and collaborative supply chain:

SCM1886: Optimize your supply chain processes with SAP BTP | 7 Oct, 12:00PM – 12:20PM

In this session Craig will discuss how SAP BTP can help to unlock the potential for creating additional business value across supply chain processes.

SCM2278: Connecting the dots: A collaborative integration workshop | 7 Oct, 3:30PM – 4:45PM

Here Craig will lead an interactive workshop designed to get you thinking about how systems link together and how to get the most out of your approaches to integration. I think you’ll enjoy this one, so don’t miss it!

Automate for Efficiency

Automation and extension are two technology capabilities that can have a dramatic and positive effect on the efficiency, accuracy and productivity of business processes, as you’ll see if you attend this session led by my colleague Loujein Mouammer:

SCM1891 - Reimagine supply chain processes with automation and custom extensions | Oct 8, 12:00PM – 12:20PM

Here Loujein will take you through a demonstration of how automation and extension can help improve operational processes and drive better business outcomes.

Build Your Own Connections with the SAP Team

If you are attending SAP Connect this year, then while I’m sure that you’ll enjoy the SAP BTP sessions delivered by Loujein and Craig, if you are curious to learn more, why not take the opportunity to connect directly with members of the SAP BTP team, and delve into the topics of Integration, Automation and Extensibility a little more deeply. You’ll find the team located at our demo stations on the show floor, and I know that they’ll be excited to speak with you:

CROSS2318 | Connect the enterprise with SAP Integration Suite

CROSS2319 | Create AI agents and apps with SAP Build solutions

Of course if you’re unable to join the live event, then please consider joining the online event and experience SAP Connect Virtual from the comfort of your own office.

However you decide to attend, in-person or online, then I do hope you find SAP Connect to be a truly inspirational and rewarding experience. And of course – enjoy all the SAP BTP sessions!
